meanings.definition: To remove a hyphen from a word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: I will unhyphenate the compound word to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: It is important to unhyphenate the term for clarity in the document.
meanings.sent3: After I unhyphenate the word, it looks much cleaner on the page.
meanings.sent4: She decided to unhyphenate the long word, revealing its true meaning.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to unhyphenate the term to understand it better.

meanings.definition: To separate a hyphenated word into its individual parts.
meanings.sent1: Let's unhyphenate the word to see its components clearly.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to unhyphenate complex terms correctly.
meanings.sent3: When you unhyphenate the word, it's like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: She had to unhyphenate the term to analyze each part separately.
meanings.sent5: The linguist will unhyphenate the compound word to study its origins.
